{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Hikmat Shihabi
({{lang-ar|حكمت الشهابي}}) |birth_date= {{birth date|1931|7|1|df=y}} |death_date={{Death date and age|2013|3|5|1931|1|8|df=y}} |office = Member of the [[Regional Command of the Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region|Regional Command]] of the [[Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region|Syrian Regional Branch]] |term_start = 7 January 1980 |term_end = 1 July 1998 |image= |party = [[Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region|Syrian Regional Branch]] of the [[Ba'ath Party (Syrian-dominated faction)|Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party]] |religion = [[Sunni Islam]] |birth_place = [[Al-Bab]], [[Aleppo Governorate]], [[Syria]] |death_place = |allegiance ={{flag|Syria}} |branch = [[Syrian Arab Army]] |serviceyears = 1952-1998 |rank = [[File:Syria-Feriq Awal.jpg|30px]] [[Colonel General]] |unit = 10th Armoured Division |commands = Syrian Arab Army
[[10th Armoured Division]] |battles =[[Six-Day War]]
[[Yom Kippur War]] |awards = Hero of the Republic |relations = |laterwork = }} '''Hikmat Shihabi''' ({{lang-ar|حكمت الشهابي}}‎ 8 January 1931 – 5 March 2013) was a Syrian career military officer, who served as the chief of staff of the [[Syrian Army]] between 1974 and 1998. ==Early life and education== Shihabi was born into a [[Sunni Islam|Sunni]] family in 1931 in [[Al-Bab]], [[Aleppo Governorate|Aleppo province]].{{cite news|title=Assad retires chief of staff, sacks intelligence chief|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/assad-retires-chief-of-staff-sacks-intelligence-chief.aspx?pageID=438&n=assad-retires-chief-of-staff-sacks-intelligence-chief-1998-07-04|accessdate=8 March 2013|newspaper=Hurriyet Daily News|date=4 July 1998|agency=AP|location=Cairo}}{{cite book|author=Sami M. Moubayed|title=Steel and Silk|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sC-xU8QHSooC&pg=PA83|accessdate=3 April 2013|year=2006|publisher=Cune Press|isbn=978-1-885942-40-1|page=83}} He attended [[Homs Military Academy|Homs military academy]] and then had advanced military training in [[the United States]]. ==Career== Shihabi began his career in aviation, training in the [[Soviet Union]] and the [[United States]]. From 1968 to 1971 he served as deputy head of the military security department. In 1970, he earned a Soviet degree in intelligence services. In April 1971, he was named head of intelligence services of the ([[Military Intelligence (Syria)|military intelligence]]), assisted by Colonel [[Ali Duba]]. He was promoted to a general the following year, and supervised the department of military security. After the 1973 [[Yom Kippur War]], he led the Syrian delegation to the United States in April 1974, negotiating the conditions of the Syrian–Israeli disengagement. On 12 August 1974, he was appointed chief of staff of the Syrian Army, replacing [[Yusuf Shakkur]], who was promoted to deputy defense minister. In December 1983, while President [[Hafez Assad]] was ill, Shihabi was part, along with General [[Mustafa Tlass]] and Ali Duba, of the committee in charge of running the country. From 1994 to 1995 he was part of a delegation that traveled to the United States to discuss peace negotiations with Israel.{{cite book|last=Faure|first=Claude|title=Dictionary of the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict: Culture, History, and Politics|publisher=Macmillan Reference USA|isbn=0-02-865977-5|page=432|year=2002}} His term as chief of staff lasted until 1998.{{cite book|author=Eyal Ziser|title=Asad's Legacy: Syria in Transition|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_KR89t0433sC&pg=PA34|accessdate=3 April 2013|year=2001|publisher=C. Hurst, Publishers, Limited|isbn=978-1-85065-450-6|page=34}} Shihabii was also one of [[Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region|Ba'ath Party]]'s four-member “old guard” members of the Regional Command.{{cite journal|last=Bar |first=Shmuel |title=Bashar’s Syria: The Regime and its Strategic Worldview |journal=IPS |year=2006 |url=http://www.herzliyaconference.org/_Uploads/2590Bashars.pdf |accessdate=12 March 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723214138/http://www.herzliyaconference.org/_Uploads/2590Bashars.pdf |archivedate=23 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }} ===Resignation=== On 8 July 1998, after 24 years as army chief of staff, Shihabi resigned his post prior to Hafez Assad's death and was succeeded by [[Ali Aslan]].{{cite book|title=Political Chronology of the Middle East|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eCSOT0_JAnwC&pg=PA2038|accessdate=10 February 2013|date=12 October 2012|publisher=Routledge|isbn=978-1-135-35673-6|page=2038}}{{cite journal|last=Zisser|first=Eyal|title=Will Bashshar al-Asad Rule?|journal=The Middle East Quarterly|date=September 2000|pages=3–12|url=http://www.meforum.org/69/will-bashshar-al-asad-rule|accessdate=14 August 2013}} Shihabi cited health reasons and a heart condition when asked about his resignation by president Assad who wanted to extend his service. http://www.aljazeera.net/programs/the-interview/2017/2/28/عبد-الحليم-خدام-ج2 In 2000, rumors surfaced in Syrian newspapers, which proved false, claiming that Shihabi would soon be indicted on corruption charges.{{cite journal|last=Ghadbian|first=Najib|title=The New Asad: Dynamics of Continuity and Change in Syria|journal=Middle East Journal|date=Autumn 2001|volume=55|issue=4|pages=624–641|url=http://offiziere.ch/wp-content/uploads/The-New-Assad.pdf|accessdate=9 March 2013}} ===Alliances=== Shihabi was one of the senior Syrian officials who were close to late [[Rafik Hariri]], former prime minister of [[Lebanon]],{{cite book|author=William Harris|title=Lebanon: A History, 600-2011|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jY4ImTGnamUC&pg=PA262|accessdate=10 March 2013|date=19 July 2012|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19-518111-1|page=262}}{{cite journal|last=Mugraby |first=Muhamad |title=The syndrome of one-time exceptions and the drive to establish the proposed Hariri court |journal=[[Mediterranean Politics]], special issue: The Politics of Violence, Truth and Reconciliation in the Arab Middle East |volume=13 |issue=2 |pages=171–194 |publisher=[[Taylor and Francis]] |doi=10.1080/13629390802127513 |date=July 2008 |url=https://dx.doi.org/10.1080/13629390802127513 |ref=harv |postscript=. }} [http://www.cggl.org/publicdocs/20080707.pdf Pdf.] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012044649/http://www.cggl.org/publicdocs/20080707.pdf |date=12 October 2013 }} and Lebanon's Druze leader [[Walid Jumblatt]].{{cite news|last=Glass |first=Charles |title=The lord of no man's land: A guided tour through Lebanon's ceaseless war |url=http://www.charlesglass.net/archives/2007/03/the_lord_of_no.html |accessdate=9 April 2013 |work=Harper's Magazine |date=1 March 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130208085020/http://www.charlesglass.net/archives/2007/03/the_lord_of_no.html |archivedate=8 February 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ==Death== Shihabi died on 5 March 2013.{{cite news|title=Syrian army mourns death of former chief of staff|url=http://www.china.org.cn/world/Off_the_Wire/2013-03/05/content_28140122.htm|accessdate=5 March 2013|work=China|date=5 March 2013}} ==References== {{Reflist|33em}} {{SyrianArmyChiefsOfStaff}} {{Ba'ath Party}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shihabi, Hikmat}} [[Category:1931 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:Homs Military Academy alumni]] [[Category:People from Al-Bab District]] [[Category:Syrian Sunni Muslims]] [[Category:Chiefs of Staff of the Syrian Army]] [[Category:Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Syria Region politicians]] [[Category:People of the Islamic uprising in Syria]]

page.title: Ian Carmichael on stage, screen and radio

revision.comment: Adding [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "English actor" ([[User:Galobtter/Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{short description|English actor}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2015}} {{Use British English|date=August 2015}} The English actor and comedian [[Ian Carmichael]] [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] (1920–2010) performed in many mediums of [[light entertainment]], including theatre, radio, television and film. His career spanned from 1939 until his death in 2010. According to Brian McFarlane, writing for the [[British Film Institute]], Carmichael "epitomises the good-natured, undemanding pleasures of '50s British cinema". Carmichael made his professional stage debut in 1939 while he was studying at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]]; his role was as a robot in the [[science fiction]] play ''[[R.U.R.]]'', which lasted for only a week.{{sfn|Fairclough|2011|p=27}} His studies were interrupted by the Second World War, and he was commissioned into the [[Royal Armoured Corps]]; he also joined an entertainment unit, 30 Corps Theatrical Pool, for which he produced twenty shows. At the end of the war he returned to professional acting, and in 1947 he took a role in ''She Wanted a Cream Front Door'', which ran in the [[West End theatre|West End]] for nine months. He continued to perform in the theatre throughout the rest of his career, largely in the UK, but also in productions in Canada, South Africa and the United States. In 1947 Carmichael made his debut on television in the [[revue]] ''New Faces''.{{sfn|Carmichael|1979|p=205}} He continued to work in television throughout his life and, according to McFarlane, achieved considerable success with [[P.G. Wodehouse]]'s ''The World of Wooster'' in 1966–67, in which he played [[Bertie Wooster]], and as [[Lord Peter Wimsey]] between 1972 and 1975. Carmichael made his radio debut in 1947 in the [[BBC Home Service]]'s ''[[Saturday Night Theatre]]'', and continued to appear throughout his career. Included in his output were dramatisations of the Wimsey novels and Wodehouse's works, this time as [[Galahad Threepwood]] in the [[Blandings Castle]] stories. In 1948 Carmichael made his cinematic debut in an uncredited role in ''[[Bond Street (film)|Bond Street]]'',{{sfn|Fairclough|2011|p=27}} and went on to establish a film career in the 1950s when he appeared in films by the [[Boulting brothers]], including ''[[Private's Progress]]'' (1956), ''[[Lucky Jim (1957 film)|Lucky Jim]]'' (1957), ''[[Brothers in Law (film)|Brothers in Law]]'' (1957), ''[[Happy Is the Bride]]'' (1958) and ''[[I'm All Right Jack]]'' (1959). On Carmichael's death in 2010 [[Dennis Barker]], writing for ''[[The Guardian]]'', observed that "what made Carmichael notable was that he could play fool parts in a way that did not cut the characters completely off from human sympathy: a certain dignity was always maintained." ==Stage credits== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="margin-right: 0;" |+ Stage credits of Ian Carmichael |- ! scope="col" | Production{{sfn|Gaye|1967|pp=428–29}} ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Theatre

{{BLP sources|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox martial artist |name = John Williams |other_names = Gray Wolf, Dr. John Williams |birth_date = 1940 |birth_place = [[Canada]] |nationality = {{flagicon|CAN}} | height = {{convert|1.88|m |ftin}} | weight_class = [[Heavyweight]] | reach = | style = [[Judo]], [[Mixed Martial Arts]] | fighting_out_of = [[Canada]] | team = Team Williams | rank = {{color box|Black}} ''black belt in [[Judo]]'' | trainer = | kickbox_win = 1 | kickbox_kowin = | kickbox_loss = 0 | kickbox_koloss = | kickbox_draw = | kickbox_nc = | am_win = | am_kowin = | am_subwin = | am_loss = | am_koloss = | am_subloss = | am_draw = | am_nc = | url = | sherdog = | footnotes = | updated = |years_active = 2010 |occupation = Doctor, Professional Mixed Martial Arts Fighter }}{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}}
'''Dr. John "Gray Wolf" Williams''' became the oldest active professional mixed martial artist at age 70, when he made his professional fight debut against Larry Brewbaker on July 24, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|last=Fowlkes |first=Ben |url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2010/07/29/70-year-old-mma-fighter-john-williams-got-in-the-cage-to-feel-al/ |title=70-Year-Old MMA Fighter John Williams Got in the Cage to Feel Alive Again |publisher=MMA Fighting |date=2010-07-29 |accessdate=2012-02-16}}</ref>
==Early life== John Williams was born in the small town of Moncton, New Brunswick, Canada on March 7, 1940.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://mrjamesryan.com/2010/07/22/dr-john-williams-70-year-old-mma-fighter-setting-guinness-world-records/|title=Dr. John Williams: 70-Year-Old MMA Fighter Setting Guinness World Records|last=Ryan|first=James|date=July 22, 2010|website=The Fallen Trail|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-03-21}}</ref> Williams belonged to the Native American tribe Wabenaki, and was a direct ancestor of the great Wabenaki war chief Madockaweando.<ref name=":0" /> Both of John's parents spoke French and were part of the Wabenaki tribe. Dr. John Williams has always been an avid mixed martial artist (MMA) fighter, and started fighting at the juvenile age of 7.<ref name=":0" /> Williams picked up fast on mixed martial arts (MMA), and by age 16 he had already received training in Olympic-style weightlifting, Kodokan Judo, and Tani-Ha Jiu-Jitsu.<ref name=":0" /> By the time John reached the age of 23, he had started giving demonstrations that authenticated pure forms of strength and ability. Some of the tasks he performed included, bending spikes, tearing phonebooks and license plates in half, and holding two jeeps from going in the opposite directions.<ref name=":0" />
==Martial Arts/MMA Career== Williams became so influential through the sport of mixed martial arts (MMA), that he eventually opened up a Jiu-Jitsu practice in the United States in 1963.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.inmemoriam.ca/view-announcement-485198-john-williams.html|title=John Williams: obituary and death notice on InMemoriam|website=www.inmemoriam.ca|language=en|access-date=2017-03-23}}</ref> Although having his own practice which kept him busy in the sport, Williams went on to teach a variety of seminars all over the world. Williams brought the sport of MMA to Canada, and also was one of the first record holders of several different events.<ref name=":1" /> Williams was part of a very successful Canadian wrestling team which happened to be one of the top three in Canada at the time.<ref name=":1" /> He won Mr. Moncton title in the late 1950s and entered the [[Guinness Book of World Records]] in the 1980s. In 1987, Williams set a world record for breaking multiple blocks of ice with a single punch. Each block was 11 inches thick, 22 inches wide, 42 inches long, and were stacked one on top of the other 10 consecutive blocks in a pile. This record still stands today. Some other records in the name of John Williams consists of, 13 consecutive hours of [[judo]] throws, over 100 weightlifting records, which include a world record for lifting 505 pounds in the one-handed deadlift at 160 pound bodyweight. Sadly, this record was disproved as the world record for this lift was already achieved in 1920. He fought in kickboxing, amateur and professional boxing, and he competed in both karate and judo.
Williams debut his amateur MMA fighting career in November 2000, and fought nine times, with a record of four wins and five losses.<ref>http://www.sherdog.com/fighter/John-Williams-5388</ref>
At seventy-years old, Williams decided to set a new record. He wanted to become the oldest professional debuting mixed martial arts fighter in history. However, athletic commissions were opposed to this idea. Williams had to pass a volume of both physical and medical tests to prove it was safe for him to compete in professional mixed martial arts. Williams passed all the tests.
Prior to competing against former professional wrestler Larry Brewbaker, Williams wanted to prove a serious point on his insight concerning professional fighting and the association it has with age. Williams emphasized the fact that, "as a person becomes a senior, society kind of pushes them out of the loop. The attitude around them is that they're dumb, they can't do anything, physically they're just vegetables, and there sort of shunned by society."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mmafighting.com/2010/07/29/70-year-old-mma-fighter-john-williams-got-in-the-cage-to-feel-al|title=70-Year-Old MMA Fighter John Williams Got in the Cage to Feel Alive Again|date=2010-07-29|website=MMA Fighting|access-date=2017-03-22}}</ref> Williams wanted to prove that he was not just another senior citizen in society, but that he was capable of achieving victory in a professional fight; which many people thought was impossible at his age.
In an interview prior to his match, Williams said, "I went and got information on discrimination towards a person because of age, and I realized that if I say this is my job and I’m physically capable of doing the job, there was no way in the world they could stop me. This had nothing to do with risk factors. When you know what you’re doing, MMA is safe. I could have done an amateur thing or an exhibition, but no, I wanted to do a real fight."<ref name=":0" />
==Record breaking MMA debut match== Williams, sporting a long pony-tail, met Larry Brewbaker, 49, a used car salesman with a shaved head and multiple tattoos. Their fight took place in Moncton, New Brunswick, Canada,on July 24, 2010, at the "Elite 1 – Wild Card".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://prommanow.com/index.php/2010/07/29/mma-fighter-john-williams-wins-pro-debut-at-70-years-old/ |title=MMA fighter John Williams wins pro debut at 70-years-old |publisher=Pro MMA Now |date=2010-07-29 |accessdate=2012-02-16}}</ref>
The 70-year-old Williams set three records that night. He became the oldest debuting MMA fighter, the oldest active MMA fighter, and the oldest winning MMA fighter. Williams won his match by ankle lock in the 2nd round.
In an interview after his record making victory, Williams said, "The point of life is living it. And I tell you, I got in that cage and I felt alive. I felt human again. You get that thing over your head, people think you’re 70 and you don’t know [expletive]. They don’t bother to get to know you. I like Eminem. I like rap music. …Mentally, I feel the same as I did when I was 30. I like the same kind of cars, make the same kind of ridiculous claims, and the enjoy same kinds of women. Nothing’s changed for me, but there’s this stereotype. You don’t change, but they try and make you fit a mold and be something you don’t want to be, which is an old person. Not me. I’ve been a fighter all my life."<ref name=":0" />
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Williams, John}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:First Nations sportspeople]] [[Category:Canadian male mixed martial artists]] [[Category:Abenaki people]]

revision.text:
'''Joseph Godfrey''' (1835 – July, 1909) was an [[African American]] who escaped from [[slavery in the United States|slavery]] into a [[Dakota people|Dakota]] community in [[Minnesota]], United States, and fought on their side during the [[Dakota War of 1862]]. He was the only African-American combatant of the war.<ref name=Francois>{{cite web | last=Francois | first=Sherick | title=Godfrey, Joseph (ca.1830–1909) | url=http://www.mnopedia.org/person/godfrey-joseph-ca1830-1909 | work=MNopedia | publisher=Minnesota Historical Society | date=2012-11-01 | accessdate=2017-11-30}}</ref>
==Background== Joseph Godfrey was born a slave in 1835 in [[Mendota, Minnesota]]. He was the son of a [[French Canadian]] [[voyageurs|voyageur]] named Joseph Godefroi and Polly, a female slave brought from [[St. Louis, Missouri]], to [[Fort Snelling]] by an American army officer. Godfrey was raised in the household of Alexis Bailley, where his mother worked. Not much is known about his childhood, except that he received little to no education. At some point Godfrey was taken to [[St. Paul, Minnesota]], by a man named Bronson. During this time Godfrey served as an aid for [[Henry Hastings Sibley]], prominent trader and later first [[governor of Minnesota]], who also played a key role in the U.S.-Dakota War.<ref name=Francois />
Suffering ill treatment from his owners, Godfrey ran away to seek refuge among the Dakota as a [[fugitive slave]]. In 1857 he moved to the [[Lower Sioux Agency]], where he married the daughter of Wahpaduta (Red Leaf). In August 1862, while helping local Dakota load hay onto a wagon, Godfrey was approached by another Dakota man announcing that all the white people had been killed at the agency. On the spot, Godfrey was asked what side he would take. Afraid for his life and family, Godfrey felt compelled to join the war.<ref name=Francois />
=="Slayer of Many"== Later that fall Godfrey was accused by Col. Sibley of joining the Dakota between August 19th and September 29th and actively participating in attacks. Dakota warriors awarded him the name "Atokte," meaning "slayer of many" in the [[Dakota language]]. Godfrey denied he had killed anyone. However, there were conflicting reports about his role in the conflict and how active he really was.<ref name=Francois />
==Testimony and pardon== Godfrey was captured after the [[Battle of Wood Lake]] on September 23, 1862, and held to face trial. He was the first person tried by the military commission on September 28, 1862. In an effort to escape execution, Godfrey testified against eleven of the thirty-eight Dakota warriors who were eventually hanged on December 26, 1862. Although he escaped conviction for murder, he was convicted of participating in the fighting and sentenced to death by hanging. In exchange for his testimony, the commission recommended that the President commute his sentence to ten years' imprisonment. In its recommendation to President [[Abraham Lincoln]], the court commission stated that "a large number of men of the very worst character would have gone unpunished" without Godfrey's testimony. Lincoln agreed to the commutation, and later issued a full pardon.<ref name=Francois />
Godfrey was sent to [[Camp McClellan (Iowa)|Camp McClellan]] in [[Davenport, Iowa]], to serve his prison sentence. After serving three years he was pardoned and freed in 1866. Upon his release, he settled on the [[Santee Sioux Reservation]] in [[Nebraska]]. Godfrey spent the rest of his life on the Santee Reservation, and died there from natural causes in July 1909. His body was buried in the Episcopalian Cemetery on the reservation.<ref name=Francois />
==References== Bachman, Walt. ''Northern Slave, Black Dakota: The Life and Times of Joseph Godfrey''. Bloomington, Minn: Pond Dakota Press, 2013. {{MNopedia|wstitle=Godfrey, Joseph (1835-1909)}} {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Godfrey, Joseph}} [[Category:1835 births]] [[Category:1909 deaths]] [[Category:African-American history of Minnesota]] [[Category:African-American people]] [[Category:Dakota War of 1862]] [[Category:People from Mendota, Minnesota]]

revision.text:
[[Image:Katoucha.jpg|thumb|right|200px|The cover of Katoucha Niane's 2007 book, "''Dans ma chair''".]]
'''Katoucha Niane''' (23 October 1960 – 2 February 2008) was a [[Senegalese]] [[model (person)|model]]. Nicknamed "The [[Peul]] Princess" (in reference to her ethnic [[Fula people|Fula]] background), she worked, and later wrote, under the single name "'''Katoucha'''". She was the daughter of [[author]], [[playwright]] and [[historian]] [[Djibril Tamsir Niane]].
==Early life and career== When she was a child, Katoucha and her family was forced into exile after her father came into conflict with Guinean President, [[Sekou Toure]]. Living with an uncle in [[Mali]], she rejoined her family in [[Dakar]] at the age of 12. There she lived with the family of her paternal uncle, whose wife was private secretary to the President of [[Senegal]], [[Léopold Sédar Senghor]].<ref>Pierrette Fofana. [http://grioo.com/ar,katoucha_la_mode_et_l_excision_vues_par_elle_meme_dans_ma_chair_paris_2007,12938.html Katoucha, la mode et l'excision vues par elle même : ''Dans ma chair'', Paris 2007 (Review)]. 11 February 2008.</ref> After marrying her husband at the age of 17 and giving birth to her first child, they emigrated to [[France]].
It was there in the 1980s that she began modeling; first for [[Thierry Mugler]], then for [[Paco Rabanne]] and [[Christian Lacroix]], and became known as [[Yves Saint-Laurent (designer)|Yves Saint Laurent]]'s "[[muse]]".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2008/02/29/wmodel129.xml |title=Supermodel Katoucha Niane found dead |accessdate=2008-02-29 |format= |work=The Daily Telegraph | location=London | first=Peter | last=Allen | date=29 February 2008}}</ref> She remained one of the best-known models in France, and an icon in Guinea. In 2005, she worked as host of the French-language television program ''[[France's Next Top Model]]''.{{Citation needed|date=March 2012}} She was the star of the film ''[[Ramata (film)|Ramata]]'' (2007), directed by [[Léandre-Alain Baker]], in which she played the title role. It tells of a Senegalese woman who, aged 50, discovers the pleasures of the flesh in the arms of a man 25 years younger. ''Ramata'' was released in France in 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://cinema.nouvelobs.com/personnalites/18833-leandre-alain-baker/biographie |title = Léandre Alain Baker |work = CineObs |accessdate = 2012-03-23 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://archive.is/20130104111029/http://cinema.nouvelobs.com/personnalites/18833-leandre-alain-baker/biographie |archivedate = 2013-01-04 |df = }}</ref>
==Activist== Niane stopped modeling in 1994 to focus on activism. She had been an outspoken activist against [[Female genital cutting|female circumcision]], a rite performed in some African nations. Following her success as a model, she started the organization ''KPLCE - Katoucha pour la lutte contre l’excision'' (English: ''Katoucha for the battle against female circumcision''). Niane herself was circumcised at the age of nine. In 2007, she published a book about her personal circumcision experience, ''Dans ma chair'' (Eng: ''In My Flesh''), in France.
==Death== Katoucha lived in a [[houseboat]] on the [[Seine]], near the [[Pont Alexandre III|Alexander III bridge]] in [[Paris]]. On 1 February 2008, she returned to her houseboat from a party. This was the last time she was reportedly seen alive. On 4 February 2008, police opened a missing persons case for her. Her purse was found untouched outside the door to her boat. Police believed that no [[homicide|foul play]] was involved, and that she was likely intoxicated and fell into the Seine.<ref name="spm">{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article3345987.ece|title=Supermodel Campaigner Missing After Party|accessdate=2008-02-28|date=2008-02-11|author=Adam Sage|work=Times Online | location=London}}</ref>
Her body was found in the [[Seine River]] on 28 February 2008. The 47-year-old model is believed to have died from an accidental drowning. [[Fox News Channel]] reported the family suspected Niane may have been the victim of foul play.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * {{fr}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20080302093705/http://www.katoucha-niane.com/ Official website] * {{fr}} [http://kplce.over-blog.com/ KPLCE blog] * {{fr}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20080305052117/http://sudonline.sn/spip.php?article8981 Review of "Dans ma chair"] * {{fr}} [http://www.cyberpresse.ca/article/20071010/CPACTUEL/710100581/-1/CPACTUEL Interview sur cyberpresse.ca] * {{fr}} [http://www.lefigaro.fr/actualites/2008/02/06/01001-20080206ARTFIG00466-l-ancien-top-modele-katoucha-a-disparu.php Annonce disparition Le Figaro] * {{fr}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20080312012641/http://www.lobservateur.sn/articles/showit.php?id=16351&cat=culture ''L'Observateur'': "Katoucha retrouvée morte dans la Seine"] (cette annonce de découverte est démentie par la police [https://web.archive.org/web/20080210184011/http://fr.news.yahoo.com/purepeople/20080207/ten-katoucha-la-police-nationale-lance-u-0111c6b_1.html]) * {{fr}} [http://www.respectance.com/KatouchaNaine/ Mémorial Katoucha Naine] *{{fr}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20080304024753/http://www.guineenews.org/articles/article.asp?num=200822963511 "Confirmation du décès de Katoucha Niane: le corps du mannequin guinéen a été identifié"]. Alpha Issa Thiam, Guineenews.org, 29 February 2008.{{Dead link|date=July 2010}} * {{IMDb name|0441454}} * {{Fashionmodel}} * {{Find a Grave|86465036}} *[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/obituaries/article3460071.ece Katoucha Niane: obituary]. ''The Times'' (London), 1 March 2008 *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7271011.stm "Top model's body found in river"], [[BBC]], Friday, 29 February 2008 *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080605083802/http://www.michel-lafon.fr/livres-temoignage/titre-496,dans-ma-chair.html Dans ma chair]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Niane, Katoucha}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths by drowning]] [[Category:Fula people]] [[Category:Guinean emigrants to France]] [[Category:People from Conakry]] [[Category:People from Paris]] [[Category:French female models]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in France]] [[Category:Guinean expatriates in Mali]]

{{about|the ethnic group native to Kalimantan|the larger group residing in Brunei, Labuan, Sabah and Sarawak|Kedayan}} {{Infobox ethnic group |group = Kendayan people
Dayak Kanayatn |image = [[File:Dayak Kanayatn.jpg|300px]] |caption = A Kendayan dancer in traditional attire performs at a church dedication service in [[Landak Regency]], [[West Kalimantan]], [[Indonesia]]. |population = 366,000{{cite web|url=http://joshuaproject.net/people_groups/14829/ID |title=Dayak Kendayan in Indonesia |publisher=[[Joshua Project]] |accessdate=2014-11-07}} |popplace = {{flag|Indonesia}} ([[West Kalimantan]]) |langs = [[Kendayan language]], [[Ahe language]], [[Nana language]], Damea or Jare language, [[Ape language]] |rels = [[Folk religion]] (predominantly), [[Christianity]] |related = [[Bidayuh]] ([[Selako people]]) }} The '''Kendayan''' (also known as '''Dayak Kenyan''' or '''Kanayatn''') are an Indonesian ethnic group native to [[Kalimantan]], [[Indonesia]] in [[Borneo]]. The population of the group is around 366,000. ==Language== [[Kendayan language|Kanayatn languages]] encompass the Brahe, Badame, Jare, and Bang app languages. Socio-linguistically, it is very difficult to specify the language repertoire because it is used with various dialects and patois pronunciation. However, these languages are all considered a part of the [[Malayic languages|Malayic language]] family which also includes Indonesia's official language, [[Malay language|Malay]]. The increased adoption of Indonesian words by the Kanayatn has drastically changed Dayak Kanayatn dialects for modern speakers. With many speakers of traditional dialects in the older generations, this change has resulted in communication problems between generations. ==Weapons== The Tangkitn is a unique weapon to the Kanayatn people and was used as their primary [[headhunting|head-hunting]] weapon in the past.{{cite book|contribution=Indonesia. Kementerian Percepatan Pembangunan Kawasan Timur Indonesia. Deputi Bidang Pengembangan Ekonomi, Sosial, dan Budaya|title=Potensi Seni Dan Budaya Serta Pariwisata Kawasan Timur Indonesia|year=2005|publisher=Deputi Bidang Pengembangan Ekonomi, Sosial, dan Budaya|oclc=215153223}} In the [[Salako language]], the Tangkitn is also referred to as the [[Pandat|Parang Pandat]]. The Kanayatn tribe employed shields to deflect attacks from swords. According to the Kanayatn people in [[Mempawah Regency|Mempawah]] (Compaq-mem pa wah Hulu-mental-too-Sada Niang), there are two types of shields in Kanayatn culture: Gun amp and Jabakng. However, according to Kanayatn members in [[Landak Regency|Landak]] (including sea Ambawang and Kuala Mandor), there is just one type of shield, namely Gun amp. ==Religion== The original religion of the Kanayatn people is not the [[Kaharingan]] as it is with the [[Dayak people]]. Kanayatn Dayak's indigenous religion is inseparable from their customs (Adat). It can even be said their customs assert their religious identity. In daily practice, Kanayatn Dayak people never mention religion as their normative, but Adat (custom). This religious system is not a [[Hinduism|Hindu]] [[Kaharingan]] system. Kanayatn people refer to God as Juba.{{cite book|author=Mudiyono|title=Sistem Pengendalian Social Traditional Desa Tiang Tanjung, Propinsi Kalimantan Barat|year=1990|publisher=Departemen Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, Direktorat Jenderal Kebudayaan, Direktorat Sejarah dan Nilai Tradisional, Proyek Inventarisasi dan Pembinaan Nilai-Nilai Budaya|oclc=555243328}} Juba is said to have passed down indigenous customs to the ancestors of Dayak Kanayatn located in Bukit Ba wang (now entering the district [[Bengkayang]]). In expressing belief in Jubata, they have a place of worship called "panyugu" or "padagi" (kadiaman).{{cite book|author=Hermann Vierling|title=Hermeneutik, Stammesreligion, Evangelium: interkulturelle Kommunikation bei den Kendayan|year=1990|publisher=Gütersloher Verlagshaus G. Mohn|isbn=3-5790-0243-0}} It is also important for the ''panyangahatn'' priest to become a liaison between man and God (Jubata).{{cite book|author=Rohany|title=Peralatan Produksi Tradisional Dan Perkembangannya Daerah Kalimantan Barat|year=1990|publisher=Departemen Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, Kanwil Depdikbud Propinsi Kalimantan Barat, Proyek Inventarisasi dan Pembinaan Nilai-Nilai Budaya Kalimantan Barat|oclc=551341177}} Today, many Dayak Kanayatn have embraced other religions, including [[Christianity]] and [[Islam]]. Kenanyatn people who have embraced another religion may no longer consider themselves as Dayak Kanayatn once they have abandoned their customary practices. Similarly, Kanayatn people who have embraced [[Islam]] will no longer regard themselves as Dayak, but as [[Malay people]] or [[Orang laut]]. ==Ethnic origins (disputed)== The Kanayatn were grouped into the category clump Land Dayak-Kalimantan by H. J. Mallinckrodt; but according to C. H. Duman, they are part of the Kanayatn [[Ot Danum people|Dayak Ot Danum]] Clump-[[Ma'anyan people|Maanyan]]-[[Ngaju people|Ngaju]]. However, research completed by W. Stohr conflicts with C. H. Duman's theory. Stohr's research suggests that when considering aspects of the region, language and customary law, the Dayak Kanayatn group appears to be more closely associated with the [[Bidayuh|Land Dayak]]-Kalimantan group than the [[Ot Danum people|Ot-Danum]]-[[Ma'anyan people|Maanyan]]-[[Ngaju people|Ngaju]] group. Landmark District names have been based on the majority Dayak community Kanayatn which is part of the clump [[Bidayuh|Land Dayak]] (or Land Djak in Dutch spelling). Kanayatn and [[Selako people|Salako]] are, in fact, one tribe and [[Selako people|Salako]] people assume that "Kanayatn" is not the real name of this tribe. ==Folk songs== {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} * Kao Ada Ka Atiku{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0xdqvEQPd2s |title=Kao ada ka atiku |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Tagila-Gila{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9kIO-LzFTcs |title=Tagila-gila |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Taringat Ka' Kao{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RnlUiCO4fy8 |title=TARINGAT KA' KAO |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Cintaku Ka' Ia{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y3GshX8m6Ro |title=CINTAKU KA' IA |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Pasatn Urakng Tuha{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aFIvWndd53o |title=PASATN URAKNG TUHA |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Batamu{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c82NtTeOguU |title=BATAMU |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Babalas Pantun{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJi05Db8QCk |title=BABALAS PANTUN|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Gawe Panganten{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jyqcwkoEJkw |title=GAWE PANGANTEN|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Nunggu Kao Pulakng{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EilIHGvhhiQ |title=NUNGGU KAO PULAKNG|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Bakanalatn{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G1RSLy5ra4o |title=Bakanalatn|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Lupa Ka' Janji{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N1IxXpsEarM |title=LUPA KA' JANJI|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Buah Atiku{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=in9xAbJoOaM |title=BUAH ATIKU|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Sayang{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4BH1f3Te4MY |title=SAYANG|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Bapantun{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bzOTbnohInk |title=BAPANTUN|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Kambang Bepanggel{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WHspgn4Zlho |title=kambang bepanggel|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Sayangku Ka Kao{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XzB9UJ4kogY |title=Sayangku Ka Kao|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Ka'o Ningalat'n{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m6v-C5C6qq8 |title=Ka'o Ningalat'n|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Malam Batabur Bintakng{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sGz2uN0Teoo |title=Malam Batabur Bintakng|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * Niat Idup Badua{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q3tgWBlLeN8 |title=Niat Idup Badua|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} * 4 Tingkakok Nimang Padi{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m87lSVHXdqY |title=4 Tingkakok Nimang Padi|publisher=YouTube |accessdate=2014-11-07}} {{div col end}} ==References== {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} {{div col end}} {{Ethnic groups in Indonesia}} {{Portal|Indonesia}} [[Category:Dayak people]] [[Category:Ethnic groups in Indonesia]]

revision.comment: Robot - Removing category Philosophers who died in Nazi concentration camps per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 October 12]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox philosopher |region = [[Western philosophy]] |era = [[20th-century philosophy]] |school_tradition = [[Berlin Circle]] |image = Logician Kurt Grelling at work in his study, ca. 1934.jpg |caption = Kurt Grelling at work in his study c. 1934 |name = Kurt Grelling |birth_date = {{birth date|df=y|1886|3|2}} |birth_place = [[Berlin]] |death_date = September 1942 |death_place = [[Auschwitz concentration camp]] |main_interests = [[Philosophy of science]], [[Logic]] |notable_ideas = [[Grelling–Nelson paradox]] |influences = [[David Hilbert]] |influenced = [[Berlin Circle]], [[Vienna Circle]] }} '''Kurt Grelling''' (2 March 1886 – September 1942) was a German [[logician]] and [[philosopher]], member of the [[Berlin Circle (philosophy)|Berlin Circle]].
== Life and work == Kurt Grelling was born on 2 March 1886 in Berlin. His father, the Doctor of Jurisprudence [[Richard Grelling]], and his mother, Margarethe (née Simon), were Jewish. Shortly after his arrival in 1905 at [[University of Göttingen]], Grelling began a collaboration with philosopher [[Leonard Nelson]], with whom he tried to solve [[Russell's paradox]], which had shaken the [[foundations of mathematics]] when it was announced in 1903. Their 1908 paper<ref>{{cite book |first=K. |last=Grelling |first2=L. |last2=Nelson |chapter=Bemerkungen zu den Paradoxien von Russell und Burali-Forti |title=Abhandlungen der Fries’schen Schule II |location=Göttingen |year=1908 |pages=301–334 }} Also in: {{cite book |first=Leonard |last=Nelson |title=Gesammelte Schriften III. Die kritische Methode in ihrer Bedeutung für die Wissenschaften |publisher=Felix Meiner Verlag |location=Hamburg |year=1974 |pages=95–127 |isbn=3787302220 }}</ref> included new [[paradox]]es, including a semantic paradox that was named the [[Grelling–Nelson paradox]].
He received his doctorate in [[mathematics]] from the same university in 1910 with a [[dissertation]] on the development of [[arithmetics]] in [[axiomatic set theory]], advised by [[David Hilbert]]. In a recorded interview with [[Herbert Enderton]], [[Alfred Tarski]] mentions a meeting he had with Grelling in 1938, and says that Grelling was the author of the earliest textbook in [[set theory]], probably but wrongly referring to this dissertation, since [[William Henry Young]] and [[Grace Chisholm Young]]'s ''Set Theory'' was published in 1906.
As a skilled linguist, Grelling translated philosophical works from French, Italian and English to German, including four of [[Bertrand Russell]]'s works. He became a strong proponent of Russell's writings thereafter.
From 1911 to 1922 Grelling published exclusively journalistic articles in publications connected with the [[Social Democratic Party of Germany]].
In 1915 his father, Richard Grelling, wrote the anti-war book ''J'Accuse'', condemning the actions of the [[Central Powers]].<ref name="roll">{{cite book | title=Because I Am a German | publisher=Constable and Co. | author=Fernau, Hermann | year=1916 | location=London | page=6}}</ref> It enjoyed huge sales outside Germany. Richard followed this success up with ''Das Verbrechen'' (''The Crime''), in which he attacked his critics, who included Kurt Grelling.<ref name="les">{{cite book | title=Les causes de la Première Guerre mondiale | publisher=Éditions du Seuil | author=Droz, Jacques | year=1973 | pages=19.|language=French}}</ref>
From 1924 onwards Grelling's publications were exclusively in the field of [[Positivism|positivist philosophy]].
[[File:Stolperstein Königsberger Str 13 (Lichtf) Kurt Grelling.jpg|thumb|Memorial [[Stolperstein]] at Kurt Grelling's residence Königsberger Straße 13 in Berlin]] Unable to find a university position in [[Göttingen]] or [[Berlin]], Grelling had to teach mathematics, [[philosophy]] and [[physics]] in secondary schools. Nevertheless, he worked with [[Hans Reichenbach]] in planning the meetings of the Berlin Circle, which was closely associated with the [[Vienna Circle]]. In 1933, Reichenbach emigrated to [[Turkey]] and the [[Nazism|Nazis]] forced Grelling to retire. But he struggled to keep the Berlin Circle active by organizing small seminars and colloquia.
Grelling collaborated with [[Kurt Gödel]] and in 1936 he published an article in which he defended Gödel's [[incompleteness theorem]] against an erroneous interpretation, according to which Gödel's theorem is a paradox as Russell's paradox (see ''References'').
Although many of his relatives and friends had fled Germany, he did not think seriously about leaving until 1937, in which year he went to [[Brussels]] to work with [[Paul Oppenheim]], this time writing several papers on the analysis of scientific explanation and on [[Gestalt psychology]].
On 10 May 1940, the first day of the German invasion in Belgium, Grelling was arrested. He was deported to southern France, where he was interned for over two years under the [[Vichy regime]]. Oppenheim and [[Carl Gustav Hempel|Hempel]] tried to help Grelling by securing an appointment for him at the New School for Social Research in [[New York City]]. News of the position and a visa to the United States reached the camp where Grelling had been joined by his wife Greta, who had refused to divorce him for safety reasons. But U.S. immigration officials were perplexed by Grelling's alleged propensity towards Communism, so there was a delay that was fatal to Grelling. He and his wife were shipped to [[Auschwitz]], arriving there on September 18, 1942 and perishing in the [[gas chamber]]s that day or soon thereafter.<ref name="Emmer">{{cite book|last= Emmer|first=Michele|title=Mathematics and Culture I|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EHRDnU29PO8C&pg=PA58&dq=%22Robert+Remak%22+auschwitz&hl=en&ei=qUAiTeiJBsH-8Aam98G4Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CCcQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22Kurt%20Grelling%22%20auschwitz&f=false|year=2004|publisher=[[Axel Springer AG]]|isbn=978-3-540-01770-7|page=60}}</ref><ref>[http://www.stolpersteine-berlin.de/de/biografie/1357 Biography] (in German) at Berlin [[Stolperstein]] site</ref>
== Selected publications == *''Gibt es eine Gödelsche Antinomie?''. In: Theoria, 3, 1936. * [http://gdz.sub.uni-goettingen.de/index.php?id=11&PPN=PPN300658907&IDDOC=39594&IDDOC=39594&branch=&L=1 ''Die Axiome der Arithmetik mit besonderer Berücksichtigung der Beziehungen zur Mengenlehre'']. Dissertation, Göttingen University Press, 1910 <!---templates from de.wikipedia, need to be translated---{{GDZ|300658907}}, {{HT|uc1.b2623109|US}}, {{HT|mdp.39015017408579|US}}---> * ''Anti-J’accuse''. Eine deutsche Antwort. Zürich: Art. Institut Orell Füssli, 1916 <!---template from de.wikipedia, needs to be translated---{{HT|inu.32000007315544|US}}--->
==Notes== {{Reflist}}
== References == *C. G. Hempel, ''Autobiografia intellettuale'' in ''Oltre il positivismo logico''. Armando: Rome, 1988. (Text of an interview Hempel gave to Richard Noland in 1982, published for the first time in Italian translation in 1988). *Abraham S. Luchins and Edith H. Luchins, ''[<!---http://web.archive.org/web/20041022172937/http://enabling.org:80/ia/gestalt/kgbio.html--->http://gestalttheory.net/archive/kgrelbio.html Kurt Grelling: Steadfast scholar in a time of madness]'', Journal of Gestalt Theory, Vol. 22, Apr 2000, pp 228–281 — Includes a [http://gestalttheory.net/archive/grellpic.html picture gallery]. *Günther Sandner, ''The Berlin Group in the Making: Politics and Philosophy in the Early Works of Hans Reichenbach and Kurt Grelling''. To appear in the Proceedings of 10th International Congress of the [[International Society for the History of Philosophy of Science]] (HOPOS), Ghent, July 2014. [http://www.hopos2014.ugent.be/node/322 Abstract]
== External links == *[http://www.emis.de/cgi-bin/jfmen/MATH/JFM/quick.html Query at the Electronic Research Archive for Mathematics] *{{MathGenealogy|id=7380}} *[http://murzim.net/LP/LP17.html Biographical Notes] at <nowiki>http://murzim.net</nowiki> *[http://gestalttheory.net/archive/kgrelbio.html KURT GRELLING: STEADFAST SCHOLAR IN A TIME OF MADNESS] webpage of [[Abraham S. Luchins]] and [[Edith Hirsch Luchins|Edith H. Luchins]]<!---another source that doesn't support the rumor about 1941 death at French/Spanish border; otherwise redundant--->
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Grelling, Kurt}} [[Category:20th-century philosophers]] [[Category:German people who died in Auschwitz concentration camp]] [[Category:German philosophers]] [[Category:1886 births]] [[Category:1942 deaths]] [[Category:Jewish philosophers]] [[Category:German logicians]] [[Category:German civilians killed in World War II]] [[Category:Writers from Berlin]] [[Category:People killed by gas chamber by Nazi Germany]] [[Category:German male writers]] [[Category:Vienna Circle]] [[Category:Social democrats]] [[Category:German Jewish people who died in the Holocaust]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox artist | name = Laure Pigeon | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1882 | birth_place = [[Paris, France]] | death_date = 1965 | death_place = | field = {{plainlist| * [[Drawing]] }} | training = | movement = {{plainlist| * [[Art brut]] * [[Outsider art]] }} | works = | patrons = [[Jean Dubuffet]] | awards = | signature = }} '''Laure Pigeon''' (1882 – 1965) was a French [[Mediumship|medium]] who produced an oeuvre of 500 [[drawing]]s related to her [[Spiritualism|Spiritualist]] practice. She is considered one of the foremost [[Outsider art|Art Brut]] creators.<ref name="Aloïse and Laure Pigeon">{{cite web|title=Aloïse and Laure Pigeon. From Writings to Images - A lecture by Pascale Marini and Lise Maurer|url=http://www.artbrut.ch/en/21058/114/actu-research/aloise-and-laure-pigeon--from-writings-to-images---a-lecture-by-pascale-marini-and-lise-maurer|publisher=Collection de l'Art Brut|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref>
==Life== Laure Pigeon was born in 1882 in [[Paris]]. Laure’s mother Alida, a laundress, died when she was five years old. After her mother's death she lived in [[Brittany]] with her paternal grandmother, where she received a strict upbringing. At twenty-nine she married a dentist against the wishes of her family. Twenty-two years later she separated from her husband, Edmond, after discovering his infidelity. After their separation she lived in a boarding house where she was introduced to [[Spiritualism]] by another woman tenant. Fifteen years later, she moved into an apartment in the Paris region where she pursued a solitary practice of Spiritualism.<ref name="Collection de l'art Brut">{{cite web|title=Collection de l'art Brut: Index des Auteurs: Laure|url=http://www.artbrut.ch/fr/21004/1012/auteurs/laure|publisher=Collection de l'art Brut|accessdate=26 March 2016}}</ref>
==Work== Laure Pigeon made her first drawing at 52, under Spiritualist inspiration.<ref name="Maclagan">{{cite book|last1=Maclagan|first1=David|title=Outsider Art: From the Margins to the Marketplace|date=2010|publisher=Reaktion Books|isbn=1861895216|page=183}}</ref> From the mid 1930s onwards, Pigeon created hundreds of drawings, most featuring images of melancholy female silhouettes, others spelling out words, often embellished names: Laure, Edmond her husband, Alida her mother, Lili her sister, or the apostle Pierre to whom Laure claimed to have been married in a former life <ref name="Cardinal">{{cite journal|last1=Cardinal|first1=Roger|title=European Mediumistic Art in the Outsider Domain|journal=Raw Vision|volume=Winter 1989/90|issue=2|page=26|url=http://www.gallevery.com/assets/dynamic/documents/AZ_Roger_Cardinal_Article_-_Raw_Vision_1989.pdf|accessdate=27 March 2016}}</ref>
==Recognition== Pigeon's work, 500 large drawings and additional notebooks, was discovered after her death in 1965. [[Jean Dubuffet]] acquired her work for his [[Jean Dubuffet|Collection de l'Art Brut]].<ref name="Hidden Worlds">{{cite book|last1=Curators of the De Stadshof & Guislain Museums|title=Hidden Worlds: Outsider Art at the Museum Dr Guislain|date=2008|publisher=Lannoo Publishers|isbn=9020970232|page=83|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eiZAFYWFZqYC&pg=PA83&lpg=PA83&dq=%22laure+pigeon%22+1965&source=bl&ots=WK5XDlGgrm&sig=dwlxMN74hTOMBnD8BxZzYii_Udo&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjs7Y3Z_OPLAhUJ-GMKHSP0DOoQ6AEITTAM#v=onepage&q=%22laure%20pigeon%22%201965&f=false|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref>
==Collections and exhibits==
Laure Pigeon's work is primarily held in the [[Collection de l'Art Brut]] museum in [[Lausanne, Switzerland]]. Her drawings have been lent to other institutions for exhibitions, including the 2011 ''Habiter poétiquement le monde'' exhibit at the [[Lille Métropole Musée d’art moderne]].<ref name="LaM">{{cite web|title=Habiter poétiquement le monde EXPOSITION du 25 septembre 2010 au 30 janvier 2011|url=http://www.musee-lam.fr/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/DP-Habiter-poétiquement-SV.pdf|publisher=Lille Métropole Musée d’art moderne|accessdate=28 March 2016}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pigeon, Laure}} [[Category:1882 births]] [[Category:1965 deaths]] [[Category:French women artists]] [[Category:People from Paris]] [[Category:Drawers (artists)]] [[Category:Outsider artists]] [[Category:Women outsider artists]] [[Category:Spiritual mediums]]

page.title: List of Grand Commanders of the Dannebrog

revision.text:
'''Grand Commanders''' of the [[Order of the Dannebrog]] have been appointed by the Sovereign of the Royal Danish Orders of [[Chivalry]], i.e. the [[List of Danish monarchs|Danish monarch]], since the general reorganization of the Order by [[letters patent|royal letters patent]] of June 28, 1808. The Grand Commanders form a special class above the three ordinary classes of the Order of the Dannebrog. Thus, they outrank the [[Grand Cross|Knights Grand Cross]] of the Dannebrog. Together with the Knights of the [[Order of the Elephant]] Grand Commanders constitute the Chapter of the Royal Danish Orders of Chivalry. Grand Commanders are, or have been, either * prominent members of the [[Danish Royal Family]], * kings and emperors related to the Danish monarch, or, * other close relations of royal or princely status who are not members of the Danish Royal Family Presently seven persons wear the Grand Commander's insignia. They are the six Grand Commanders and [[Margrethe II of Denmark|HM Queen Margrethe II]], the Sovereign of the Order. By [[decree|royal ordinance]] of October 10, 1951 women can be appointed Grand Commanders. Therefore, the women that appear in the list before that date were, strictly speaking, not appointed Grand Commanders as much as awarded the honour of wearing the insignia of a Grand Commander. ==Grand Commanders of the Order of the Dannebrog== {| class="wikitable" |- ! {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Mel Ferrer | image = Mel Ferrer - 1960.jpg | caption = Ferrer in 1960 | birthname = Melchor Gastón Ferrer | birth_date = {{birth date|1917|8|25}} | birth_place = [[Elberon, New Jersey]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|2008|6|2|1917|8|25}} | death_place = [[Santa Barbara, California]], U.S. | yearsactive = 1937–1998 | occupation = Actor, director, producer | spouse = 5 times, to 4 wives:
{{marriage|Frances Pilchard |1937|1939|end=div}}
{{marriage|Barbara C. Tripp |1940|1944|end=div}}
{{marriage|Frances Pilchard |1944|1954|end=div}}
{{marriage|[[Audrey Hepburn]] |1954|1968|end=div}}
{{marriage|Elizabeth Soukhotine |1971|}} | children = 6 |relatives = [[Emma Ferrer]] (granddaughter) | awards = '''[[Walk of Fame]]'''
[[Hollywood Blvd|6240 Hollywood Blvd]] }} '''Melchor Gastón Ferrer'''Some sources spell his first name as MELCHIOR but this is incorrect based on Ferrer's records at Princeton University. Also he was named for his paternal grandfather, Melchor Ferrer. And the name MELCHOR G. FERRER was used on the cover of ''Tito's Hats'', a children's book that Ferrer wrote in 1940. (August 25, 1917 – June 2, 2008) was an American [[actor]] and [[Film director|director]] of stage and screen, [[film producer]] and the first husband of [[Audrey Hepburn]]. ==Early life== Ferrer was born in the [[Elberon, New Jersey|Elberon]] section of [[Long Branch, New Jersey]], of [[Cuban people|Cuban]] and [[Irish people|Irish]] descent. His father, Dr. José María Ferrer (1857–1920), was born in [[Cuba]], of [[Spanish people|Spanish]] ancestry, and was an authority on pneumonia and served as chief of staff of [[St. Vincent's Hospital (Manhattan)|St. Vincent's Hospital]] in New York City."Dr. Jose M. Ferrer", Obituaries, The New York Times, February 24, 1920 His American mother, Mary Matilda Irene (née O'Donohue; 1878–1967),"Weddings: Ferrer-O'Donohue", ''The New York Times'', October 19, 1910 was a daughter of coffee broker Joseph J. O'Donohue, New York's City Commissioner of Parks, a founder of the Coffee Exchange, and a founder of the Brooklyn-New York Ferry. An ardent opponent of [[Prohibition]], Irene Ferrer was named, in 1934, the New York State chairman of the Citizens Committee for Sane Liquor Laws."Mrs. J.M. Ferrer, Civic Leader, 89", ''The New York Times'', February 21, 1967. Ferrer had three siblings. His elder sister was Dr. M. Irené Ferrer, a cardiologist and educator, who helped refine the cardiac catheter and [[electrocardiogram]].[https://www.nlm.nih.gov/changingthefaceofmedicine/physicians/biography_110.html Changing the Face of Medicine – Dr. M. Irené Ferrer] She died in 2004 in Manhattan, New York at age 89 of pneumonia and congestive heart failure. His brother, Dr. Jose M. Ferrer, born 1912, was a surgeon; he died in 1982 at age 70 after an abdominal surgery complication. His other sister, Teresa (Terry) Ferrer, was the religion editor of ''[[The New York Herald Tribune]]'' and education editor of ''[[Newsweek]]''."Terry Ferrer, 82, Education Editor", ''The New York Times'', April 1, 2002 The family is not related to actors [[José Ferrer|José]] and [[Miguel Ferrer]]. His mother's family, the O'Donohues, were prominent Roman Catholics. Mel Ferrer's aunt, Marie Louise O'Donohue (Mrs. Joseph J. O'Donohue, Jr.) was named a [[Papal nobility|papal countess]],"Joseph O'Donohue, Real Estate Man, Dead", ''The New York Times'', October 31, 1937 and his mother's sister, Teresa Riley O'Donohue, a leading figure in American Catholic charities and welfare organizations, was granted permission by [[Pope Pius XI]] to install a private chapel in her New York City apartment."Teresa O'Donohue, Charities Worker", ''The New York Times'', August 18, 1937 Ferrer was privately educated at the Bovée School in New York (one of his classmates was the future author [[Louis Auchincloss]]) and [[Canterbury School (New Milford, Connecticut)|Canterbury Prep School]] in Connecticut before attending [[Princeton University]] until his sophomore year, at which time he dropped out to devote more time to acting. He also worked as an editor of a small Vermont newspaper and wrote a children's book, ''Tito's Hats'' (Garden City Publishing, 1940).The book's illustrations were by [[Jean Charlot]]. ==Career== [[File:Audrey Hepburn and Mel Ferrer 1955.jpg|thumb|240px|Audrey Hepburn and Mel Ferrer on the set of ''[[War and Peace (1956 film)|War and Peace]]'' in 1955]] ===Early theatre work=== Ferrer began acting in [[summer stock]] as a teenager and in 1937 won the Theatre Intime award for best new play by a Princeton undergraduate; the play was called ''Awhile to Work'' and co-starred another college student, Frances Pilchard, who would become Ferrer's first wife that same year."M.G. Ferrer Wins Prize Play Award", ''The New York Times'', March 3, 1937, page 27 At age twenty-one, he was appearing on the [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] stage as a chorus dancer, making his debut there as an actor two years later. He appeared as a chorus dancer in two unsuccessful musicals, [[Cole Porter]]'s ''[[You Never Know (musical)]]'' and ''Everywhere I Roam''. His first acting roles were in a revival of ''Kind Lady'' (1940) and ''Cue for Passion'' (1940) directed by [[Otto Preminger]].{{cite web |url=https://www.ibdb.com/broadway-production/kind-lady-1009 |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |title=Kind Lady |accessdate=November 16, 2017 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6v19ML5Zd?url=https://www.ibdb.com/broadway-production/kind-lady-1009 |archivedate=November 16, 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy-all }}{{cite web |url=https://www.ibdb.com/broadway-production/cue-for-passion-1042 |publisher=Internet Broadway Database |title=Cue for Passion |accessdate=November 16, 2017 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6v19VdE9F?url=https://www.ibdb.com/broadway-production/cue-for-passion-1042 |archivedate=November 16, 2017 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy-all }} After a bout with [[polio]], Ferrer worked as a disc jockey in [[Texas]] and [[Arkansas]] and moved to Mexico to work on a novel, ''Tito's Hat'' published in 1940. ===Columbia Pictures=== Ferrer was contracted to [[Columbia Pictures]] as a director along with several other "potentials" who began as dialogue directors: [[Fred F. Sears|Fred Sears]], [[William Castle]], [[Henry Levin (film director)|Henry Levin]] and [[Robert Gordon (director)|Robert Gordon]].http://www.filmsofthegoldenage.com/articles/2008/04/29/current_issue/klinekatzman.txt Among the films he worked on were ''[[Louisiana Hayride (film)|Louisiana Hayride]]'' (1944), ''[[They Live in Fear]]'' (1944), ''[[Sergeant Mike]]'' (1944), ''[[Together Again (film)|Together Again]]'' (1944), ''[[Meet Miss Bobby Socks]]'' (1944), ''[[Let's Go Steady]]'' (1944), ''[[Ten Cents a Dance (1945 film)|Ten Cents a Dance]]'' (1945), and ''[[A Thousand and One Nights (1945 film)|A Thousand and One Nights]]'' (1945). Some of these were Bs but others – such as 'Thousand and One Nights'' – were more prestigious. Ferrer directed ''[[The Girl of the Limberlost]]'' (1945) a B movie with [[Ruth Nelson (actress)|Ruth Nelson]]. ===Broadway=== Eventually, he returned to Broadway, where he starred in ''[[Strange Fruit (novel)#Stage play|Strange Fruit]]'' (1945–46), a play based on the novel by [[Lillian Smith (author)|Lillian Smith]]. It was directed by [[Jose Ferrer]] (no relation). Ferrer then directed Jose Ferrer in the 1946 stage production of ''[[Cyrano de Bergerac (play)|Cyrano de Bergerac]]''. He worked as an assistant on ''[[The Fugitive (1947 film)|The Fugitive]]'' (1947), directed by John Ford in Mexico. Along with [[Gregory Peck]], [[Dorothy McGuire]] and [[Joseph Cotten]], he founded the [[La Jolla Playhouse]] in Los Angeles. ===Screen actor=== Ferrer made his screen acting debut with a starring role in ''[[Lost Boundaries]]'' (1949), playing a black person who passes for white. The film was controversial but much acclaimed.http://articles.latimes.com/1989-07-25/entertainment/ca-343_1_johnston-family ===Howard Hughes=== Ferrer had a support role in ''[[Born to Be Bad (1950 film)|Born to Be Bad]]'' (1950) at RKO, directed by [[Nicholas Ray]]. At that studio he directed [[Claudette Colbert]] in ''[[The Secret Fury]]'' (1950) and did some directing on ''[[Vendetta (1950 film)|Vendetta]]'' (1950), ''[[The Racket (1951 film)|The Racket]]'' (1951) and ''[[Macao (film)|Macao]]'' (1952). Ferrer then starred as a bullfighter in ''[[The Brave Bulls (film)|The Brave Bulls]]'' (1951) for [[Robert Rossen]] at Columbia. Ferrer fought with [[Arthur Kennedy]] over [[Marlene Dietrich]] in ''[[Rancho Notorious]]'' (1952) directed by [[Fritz Lang]] at RKO. ===MGM=== Ferrer went over to MGM replacing [[Fernando Lamas]] as the villain in ''[[Scaramouche (1952 film)|Scaramouche]]'' (1952). The film, particularly notable for a long climactic duel between Ferrer and [[Stewart Granger]], was a huge hit. MGM kept him on for ''[[Lili]]'' (1953) playing the puppeteer loved by [[Leslie Caron]]. It was another large success; Ferrer and Caron also got a hit single out of it, "Hi-Lili-Hi-Lo". ''[[Saadia (film)|Saadia]]'' (1953), which Ferrer made with [[Cornel Wilde]] was a flop but ''[[Knights of the Round Table (film)|Knights of the Round Table]]'' (1954) was a big hit; Ferrer played King Arthur. Ferrer met [[Audrey Hepburn]] at a party and she wanted to do a play together. They appeared in ''Ondine'' (1954) on Broadway and later got married. ===Europe=== Ferrer went to Italy to make ''[[Proibito]]'' (1954) and England for ''[[Oh... Rosalinda!!]]'' (1955), directed by [[Powell and Pressburger]]. Neither film was widely seen, but ''[[War and Peace (1956 film)|War and Peace]]'' (1956) was a big success; Ferrer played Prince Andrei, co-starring with his then-wife, [[Audrey Hepburn]]. In France he supported [[Ingrid Bergman]] in ''[[Elena and Her Men]]'' (1956) directed by [[Jean Renoir]]. ===United States=== Ferrer and Hepburn made ''[[Mayerling (1957 film)|Mayerling]]'' (1957) for American television; it was released theatrically in some countries. Ferrer returned to MGM to make ''[[The Vintage]]'' (1957) with [[Pier Angeli]] which was a big flop. He made two films for [[20th Century Fox]]: their all star adaptation of ''[[The Sun Also Rises (1957 film)|The Sun Also Rises]]'' (1957) and ''[[Fräulein (1958 film)|Fräulein]]'' (1958) a war story with [[Dana Wynter]]. At MGM he was one of the last three people on Earth in ''[[The World, the Flesh and the Devil (1959 film)|The World, the Flesh and the Devil]]'' (1959), another flop. Ferrer went to Italy to be star in [[Roger Vadim]]'s vampire movie ''[[Blood and Roses]]'' (1960). After an English horror film ''[[The Hands of Orlac (1960 film)|The Hands of Orlac]]'' (1960) he did an Italian adventure film ''[[Charge of the Black Lancers]]'' (1962). Ferrer was one of several stars in ''[[The Devil and the Ten Commandments]]'' (1962) and ''[[The Longest Day (film)|The Longest Day]]'' (1962). He had a cameo in his wife's ''[[Paris When It Sizzles]]'' (1964) and was [[Marcus Aurelius Cleander]] in ''[[The Fall of the Roman Empire (film)|The Fall of the Roman Empire]]'' (1964). Ferrer turned to television, doing some directing for the series ''[[The Farmer's Daughter (TV series)|The Farmer's Daughter]]'' (1963–1966) starring [[Inger Stevens]]. Ferrer had a support role in ''[[Sex and the Single Girl (film)|Sex and the Single Girl]]'' (1964). ===Producer=== Ferrer produced and starred in the biopic ''[[El Greco (1966 film)|El Greco]]'' (1966) playing the [[El Greco|famous painter]]. He also produced ''[[Wait Until Dark (film)|Wait Until Dark]]'' (1967) starring his wife; a big hit. He and Hepburn were divorced in 1968. ===1970s=== Ferrer was mostly a jobbing actor in the 1970s, working much in Italy. Among his credits were ''[[A Time for Loving]]'' (1972); ''[[The Antichrist (film)|The Antichrist]]'' (1974) in Italy; ''[[Brannigan (film)|Brannigan]]'' (1974), a crime drama set in [[London]] that starred [[John Wayne]]; ''[[Silent Action]]'' (1975) and ''[[The Suspicious Death of a Minor]]'' (1975), both for [[Sergio Martino]]; ''[[The Net (1975 film)|The Net]]'' (1975), shot in Germany; ''[[The Black Corsair (1976 film)|The Black Corsair]]'' (1976), an Italian swashbuckler; ''[[Gangbuster (film)|Gangbuster]]'' (1977) in Italy; ''[[The Pyjama Girl Case]]'' (1977); ''[[Seagulls Fly Low]]'' (1977). He also played a blackmailing reporter in the ''[[Columbo]]'' episode "Requiem for a Fallen Star" (starring [[Anne Baxter]]). In America he was in ''[[Hi-Riders]]'' (1978), ''[[The Norseman]]'' (1978), ''[[Guyana: Crime of the Century]]'' (1979), and ''[[The Fifth Floor]]'' (1979). In 1979, he portrayed Dr. Brogli in an episode of ''[[Return of the Saint]]''. In Europe he was in ''[[The Visitor (1979 film)|The Visitor]]'' (1979), ''[[Island of the Fishmen]]'' (1980), ''[[Nightmare City]]'' (1980), ''[[The Great Alligator River]]'' (1980) and ''[[Eaten Alive!]]'' (1980). He went to Germany for ''[[Lili Marleen (film)|Lili Marleen]]'' (1981) He also appeared in two films with [[Marisol (actress)|Marisol]], the Spanish star: ''[[Cabriola]]'' (as director) and ''[[La chica del molino rojo]]'' (as actor). ===Later career=== From 1981 to 1984 he had a role opposite [[Jane Wyman]] as Angela Channing's attorney and, briefly, her husband [[Phillip Erikson]] in ''[[Falcon Crest]]'', as well as directing a few of that series's episodes. He also appeared in the mini series ''[[Peter the Great (miniseries)|Peter the Great]]'' (1986) and ''[[Dream West]]'' (1986). Later credits included ''[[Eye of the Widow]]'' (1991) and ''[[Catherine the Great (1995 film)|Catherine the Great]]'' (1995). For his contributions to the motion picture industry, Mel Ferrer has a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] at 6268 Hollywood Blvd. ==Personal life== Ferrer was married five times, to four women, with whom he had six children. His wives were: # Frances Gunby Pilchard, his first and third wife, an actress who became a sculptor."Catharsis", Time, February 10, 1941 They married in 1937, and divorced in 1939 after having one child together.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2008/jun/05/obituaries.usa |title=Obituary: Mel Ferrer |first=Ronald |last=Bergan |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=June 5, 2008 |accessdate=February 3, 2018}} # Barbara C. Tripp, they married in 1940 and later divorced. They had two children: a daughter, Mela Ferrer (born 1943) and a son, Christopher Ferrer (born 1944). # Frances Gunby Pilchard, for the 2nd time; they remarried in 1944, and divorced in 1953, after having two more children together: Pepa Philippa Ferrer and Mark Young Ferrer (born 1944). # [[Audrey Hepburn]], the actress, to whom he was married from 1954 until 1968. They had one child, a son, Sean Hepburn Ferrer (born 1960) # Elizabeth Soukhotine, from [[Belgium]], to whom he was married from 1971 to his death in 2008. Before his marriage to Elizabeth Soukhotine in 1971, Ferrer also had a relationship with 29-year-old interior designer [[Tessa Kennedy]].{{cite book|author=Paris, Barry|title=Audrey Hepburn|pages=247–248|ISBN=0-425-18212-6}}{{cite book|title=Sex Lives of the Hollywood Goddesses Part 2|author=Cawthorne, Nigel|ISBN=1-85375-514-1|page=271}} ==Death== A resident of [[Carpinteria, California]], Ferrer died of heart failure at a convalescent home in [[Santa Barbara, California|Santa Barbara]] on June 2, 2008.{{cite news |work=Yahoo! News |title=Mel Ferrer, actor-director, husband of Audrey Hepburn, dies |url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20080603/ap_en_ce/obit_ferrer |first=Bob |last=Thomas |date=June 3, 2008}} He was 90 years old. ==Filmography== '''As Actor:''' {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} *''[[The Fugitive (1947 film)|The Fugitive]]'' (1947) as Father Serra (uncredited) *''[[Lost Boundaries]]'' (1949) as Scott Mason Carter *''[[Born to Be Bad (1950 film)|Born to Be Bad]]'' (1950) as Gobby *''[[The Brave Bulls (film)|The Brave Bulls]]'' (1951) as Luis Bello *''[[Rancho Notorious]]'' (1952) as Frenchy Fairmont *''[[Scaramouche (1952 film)|Scaramouche]]'' (1952) as Noel, Marquis de Maynes *''[[Lili]]'' (1953) as Paul Berthalet *''[[Saadia (film)|Saadia]]'' (1953) as Henrik *''[[Knights of the Round Table (film)|Knights of the Round Table]]'' (1953) as Arthur *''[[Proibito]]'' (1954) as Don Paolo Salinas *''[[Oh... {{Infobox officeholder | name = Mireia Boya Busquet | image = Mireia Boya e Busquet.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1979}} | birth_place = [[Saint-Gaudens, Haute-Garonne|Saint-Gaudens]], France | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | other_names = | occupation = Professor, environmental scientist, politician | spouse = | children = | relatives = {{ill|Jusèp Boya Busquet|es}} (brother) | mother = {{ill|Maria Pilar Busquets|es}} | father = Ernesto Boya | awards = | alma_mater = [[Université de Montréal]] | signature = Signatura Mireia Boya e Busquets.jpg | party = [[Corròp]] | office = Deputy of the [[Parliament of Catalonia]] | term_start = 19 January 2016 | term_end = 28 October 2017 }} '''Mireia Boya Busquet''' (born 1979) is a Catalan scientist, activist, and politician. She is a councilor of the [[Val d'Aran|Aran]] municipality of [[Les, Catalonia|Les]]. Since February 2018 she has been part of the national secretariat of the [[Popular Unity Candidacy]] (CUP). She was a member of the [[Parliament of Catalonia|Catalan Parliament]] from 2016 to 2017.
==Biography== The daughter of Ernesto Boya and the politician {{ill|Maria Pilar Busquets|es}}, she has a degree in [[Environmental Science]]s from the [[Autonomous University of Barcelona]] (2002), a master's degree in Landscape Design (2004), and a PhD in Land Management and Planning (2009) from the [[Université de Montréal]]. In the professional field, she is a consultant and associate professor of the Humanities Department of [[Pompeu Fabra University]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.vilaweb.cat/noticies/la-cup-renova-el-40-dels-diputats-al-parlament/ |title=La CUP renova el 40% dels diputats que té al parlament |trans-title=The CUP Renews 40% of MPs in Parliament |work=[[VilaWeb]] |language=Catalan |date=11 January 2016 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref>
Mireia Boya Busquet has been a fighter for the recognition of [[Val d'Aran|Occitan]] identity of the Valley of Aran, and was the first member of the Catalan Parliament to use the [[Aranese dialect]] in the [[Parliament of Catalonia]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.esdiario.com/895533049/Rozando-el-esperpento-la-nueva-diputada-de-CUP-solo-hablara-en-aranes.html |title=Rozando el esperpento: la nueva diputada de CUP sólo hablará en aranés |trans-title=Grazing the Grotesque: The New CUP Deputy Will Only Speak in Aranese |work=ESDiario.com |language=Spanish |date=20 January 2016 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref> Her brother, {{ill|Jusèp Boya Busquet|es}}, has been general director of Archives, Libraries, Museum, and Heritage of the Generalitat beginning in January 2016, an office that he was dismissed from after the 2017 suspension of Catalonian self-government.
==Political career== Boya is a founder and former coordinator of the [[Assemblea Nacional Catalana]] in Val d'Aran and councilor in the city of [[Les, Catalonia|Les]] for the [[Corròp]] party, framed in [[Occitan nationalism]]. In the [[Catalan regional election, 2015|2015 elections to the Parliament of Catalonia]], she was a candidate of the [[Popular Unity Candidacy|CUP]] for the district of [[Province of Lleida|Lleida]], after a vote in primaries. Boya, who was second in the list in her constituency, was not elected, but on 18 December 2015, during the tense negotiations between the CUP and the pro-independence coalition [[Junts pel Sí]], the CUP's number one, Ramon Usall, resigned for personal reasons.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/politica/20151219/30915108732/diputado-cup-renuncia-ramon-usall.html |title=Voto secreto en la asamblea de la CUP para decidir si se inviste a Artur Mas |trans-title=Secret Vote in the CUP Assembly to Decide Whether to Invest Artur Mas |first=Àlex |last=Tort |work=[[La Vanguardia]] |language=Spanish |date=19 December 2015 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref> In this way, Boya occupied the post of regional parliamentarian.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.naciodigital.cat/lleida/noticia/16111/mireia/boya/sera/diputada/cup/substitucio/ramon/usall |title=Mireia Boya serà diputada de la CUP en substitució de Ramon Usall |trans-title=Mireia Boya to be CUP Deputy as Substitute for Ramon Usall |first=Àlvar |last=Llobet |work=Nació Digital |language=Catalan |date=10 January 2016 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.jornalet.com/nova/5499/una-occitanista-aranesa-candidata-al-parlament-de-catalonha-per-la-cup |title=Una occitanista aranesa candidata al Parlament de Catalonha per la CUP |trans-title=An Occitan Aranese Candidate for the Parliament of Catalonia for the CUP |work=Jornalet |language=Catalan |date=31 July 2015 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref> She participated in the plenary sessions of the Parliament that voted for the roadmap to independence for Catalonia, and voted the Unilateral declaration of Independence of Catalonia.
In the elections of 21 December 2017, of the 5,265 votes cast in Val d'Aran, the CUP received 174 – 3.3% of the total.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://resultados.elpais.com/elecciones/2017/autonomicas/09/25-39.html |title=Resultados Electorales en Aran: Elecciones Cataluña 2017 |trans-title=Electoral Results in Aran: Catalan Elections 2017 |work=[[El País]] |language=Spanish |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref>
In February 2018, she was elected a member of the CUP National Secretariat as an independent candidate with 662 votes.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/politica/20180216/44820594186/la-cup-renueva-su-cupula-con-equilibrios-internos-pese-al-exito-de-endavant.html |title=La CUP renueva su cúpula con equilibrios entre Endavant y Poble Lliure |trans-title=The CUP Renews its Leadership with Balances Between Endavant and Poble Lliure |work=[[La Vanguardia]] |agency=EFE |location=Barcelona |language=Spanish |date=16 February 2018 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref>
===Occitan nationalism=== A defender of the [[Occitania|Occitan nation]], Boya upholds a "project of a country with two languages of its own", a country that looks "to the north, to Occitania".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.lavanguardia.com/politica/20160120/301542079265/diputada-cup-aranes-parlament.html |title=La nueva diputada de la CUP sólo hablará en aranés en la tribuna |trans-title=The New CUP Deputy Will Only Speak in Aranese at the Rostrum |first=Quico |last=Sallés |work=[[La Vanguardia]] |location=Barcelona |language=Spanish |date=20 January 2016 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref>
==Judicial case== On 22 December 2017, Judge Pablo Llarena of the [[Supreme Court of Spain]] agreed on the inquiry (previously charged) for rebellion against Mireia Boya (president of the CUP's parliamentary group), [[Artur Mas]] (president of the [[Catalan European Democratic Party|PDeCat]]), [[Marta Rovira]] (secretary general of the [[Republican Left of Catalonia|ERC]]), [[Anna Gabriel i Sabaté|Anna Gabriel]] (spokesperson of the CUP), [[Marta Pascal]] (general coordinator of the CUP), and {{ill|Neus Lloveras|es}} (president of the [[Association of Municipalities for Independence|AMI]]), all for belonging to the organizing team of the [[Catalan independence referendum, 2017|Catalan independence referendum]] held on 1 October 2017 and with a decisive role in the secessionist plan, whose roadmap was annulled by the Spanish Constitutional Court.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.abc.es/espana/abci-supremo-investiga-mas-rovira-y-gabriel-rebelion-201712221105_noticia.html |title=El juez imputa a Marta Rovira, Artur Mas y Anna Gabriel en la causa por rebelión |trans-title=The Judge Accuses Marta Rovira, Artur Mas, and Anna Gabriel in the Case for Rebellion |first1=Nati |last1=Villanueva |first2=Luis P. |last2=Arechederra |work=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]] |language=Spanish |date=22 December 2017 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=https://okdiario.com/espana/cataluna/2017/12/22/imputada-boya-cup-sostiene-decision-del-supremo-venganza-1631314 |title=La imputada Boya (CUP) sostiene que la decisión del Supremo es una 'venganza' |trans-title=The Accused Boya (CUP) Maintains that the Supreme's Decision is a 'Revenge' |work=Okdiario |language=Spanish |date=22 December 2017 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref> Boya was declared as investigated on 14 February 2018, being released without precautionary measures.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.abc.es/espana/abci-mireia-boya-declara-ante-5733616839001-20180214011307_video.html |title=Mireia Boya declara ante el Tribunal Supremo |trans-title=Mireia Boya Testifies Before the Supreme Court |work=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]] |language=Spanish |date=14 February 2018 |access-date=10 July 2018}}</ref>
